title: Japanese Colonialism and Imperialism
description:
Japanese imperialism left a deep and lasting imprint
throughout Asia. This module will examine the
characteristics of the Japanese empire and its postwar
legacies, as well as the diverse issues surrounding its
history and memory. The primary focus of the module
will be a consideration of the Japanese empire in
international contexts. Students are encouraged to
apply comparative perspectives to draw implications
for a larger discussion on modern imperialism.
prerequisite:
Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in HY, with a minimum CAP of
3.20 or be on the Honours track.
